intro: Wikstroemia elongata var. recurva, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale blue or white flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and dry slopes. It has a low-growing habit with woody stems and is often found in desert scrub habitats. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
